The bipartisan Pregnant Workers Fairness Act, which has over 100 cosponsors, ensures workers have the simple, low-cost accommodations they need to stay on the job when pregnant. My #PWFA bill will guarantee that no one has to choose between a healthy pregnancy and their paycheck.

Pregnancy discrimination happens to millions of women. Pregnant workers are often forced on leave when a simple accommodation will keep them on the job. Next week @EdLaborCmte will hold a hearing to discuss my bill, the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act. #PWFA  https://edlabor.house.gov/hearings/long-over-due-exploring-the-pregnant-workers-fairness-act-hr-2694- …

I have joined with @NydiaVelazquez to introduce legislation to fully fund NYCHA’s capital needs, and I do not believe that demolishing public housing is the best way to save it. But there are hard choices ahead, and we have to make sure it is residents that are leading the way.
I appreciate @NYCMayor’s willingness to hold this RFP, and to sit with residents & community members to craft a plan that works for the residents of Fulton and Elliot-Chelsea Houses.

NYCHA residents know their community best and need to have a real voice in determining its future. Public housing is a crisis in this city, and we cannot let our neighbors continue to live in these conditions. https://nadler.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=394096 …

We need the #SCOTUS to uphold #TitleVII of the Civil Rights Act and definitively say that everyone in the country is covered under the law. 

And we need the Senate to take up the #EqualityAct to finally clarify and enshrine these and many other protections into law!
Same goes for gender identity. It is impossible to discriminate against someone for not expressing themselves in a way that aligns with how you perceive their sex without considering... their sex.

Someone’s sexual orientation or gender identity is intrinsically linked with their sex. It is impossible to discriminate against someone in a same-sex relationship without, by definition, taking their sex into consideration.

This morning the Supreme Court is hearing three cases to determine whether #LGBTQ workers are protected from discrimination under our nation’s sex non-discrimination laws, a decision that will have major consequences for our nation. #SCOTUS https://twitter.com/ACLU/status/1181546467997179904 …
